quest.name: A Treasured Mother
journal: Brangwine seems in a world to herself.

Brangwine is more than willing to give you the flawless alexandrite her son found...in exchange for a few things. The first is a Bombard core to heat her bath, and the second is a bottle of sacred spring water for stain removal. The last is a fine brass kettle of the type fashionable in the North Shroud. Obtain all three to warm her heart.

Brangwine takes what you have brought her not with a smile, but with a sigh. Though she wishes to leave Ealdwine money enough to settle down, she worries he never will have the chance. Treasure hunting is, after all, a dangerous business, and so the mother insists you make way to western La Noscea, and persuade her boy to give it up.

No less soused or stubborn than usual, Ealdwine refuses to stop treasure hunting until he finds his one, big score. Help him do so by searching Amdapor Keep, Pharos Sirius, and the Tam–Tara Deepcroft for lost treasure.

※Amdapor Keep, Pharos Sirius, and the Tam–Tara Deepcroft (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
Dirty and tired, you nevertheless now have the three treasure coffers. Return to Swiftperch so that Ealdwine might pry them open.

You watch as Ealdwine lifts the lids of coffers not opened for an age...only to find worthless junk inside. Never one to lose heart for long, though, the treasure hunter lets you in on another tip: there may be another great treasure lost in the Stone Vigil. Go now and see if there is any truth to Ealdwine's claim.

※The Stone Vigil (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
The treasure of the Stone Vigil is lost no more. Return with it to Swiftperch, and hope that this, too, is not filled with rubbish.

Excited as a little boy, Ealdwine pries opens the lost treasure from the Stone Vigil. However, once again, he finds nothing but junk. Ealdwine then proclaims he cannot give up treasure hunting yet. However, so as to not to leave you completely empty-handed, he imparts the way to his mother's heart: high-quality tailor-made eel pie and a piece of perfect cloth. Obtain these and return to Revenant's Toll.

※Certain ingredients required to craft these items can be obtained by desynthesizing aged goods sold at the Silver Bazaar.

You could not fulfill your part of the bargain, and Ealdwine remains a treasure hunter. Nonetheless, Brangwine is so pleased with her eel pie and fine fabric that she gives you the piece of flawless alexandrite anyway. With patience and persistence, she reasons, she will make her son give up treasure hunting.

※If you have obtained all four items requested by Gerolt, you may return to Hyrstmill to have your Zodiac Weapon forged.
objectives: Deliver a Bombard core, a bottle of sacred spring water, and a brass kettle to Brangwine.
Obtain the lost treasure from Amdapor Keep.
Obtain the lost treasure from Pharos Sirius.
Obtain the lost treasure from the Tam–Tara Deepcroft (Hard).
Deliver the lost treasures to Ealdwine.
Obtain the lost treasure from the Stone Vigil (Hard).
Deliver the lost treasure to Ealdwine.
Deliver a tailor-made eel pie and a piece of perfect cloth to Brangwine.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Why, if it isn't the nice womanman who wanted all those maps! What brings you Brangwine's way?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Alexandrite? Oh, that bit of crystal my son brought home? I've been using it to brighten up my garden, but if it means that much to you I suppose I could part with it.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Well, in exchange for a few things, anyway. It's just a few items that I have wanted for of late, and certainly nothing an adventurer like yourself should have any trouble with. Do we have a deal?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Good! Well, the first thing I would like you to bring me is a Bombard core. I just have to drop it into the bath and presto: boiling water to soak my bones in!

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Next, I should like some sacred spring water. My neighbor swears by it for getting stains out of dirty clothing.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: And lastly, I need a new teapot, a proper brass one. I should like something a bit easier to use than the chipped earthenware one I have now.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: I am sure you can barter or buy Bombard cores and spring water, though I do not know where. But I do believe you are like to find metal kettles in the North Shroud.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Oh my, after another bit of...alexandrite, was it? Well, you are in luck─my son just brought one home. I shall be happy to give it to you. In exchange for a few items, of course.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: The Bombard core and bottle of sacred spring water you brought were terribly useful, so I would like another one of each. Oh, and a brass kettle for good measure.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Old Brangwine will be here rain or shine, so just make sure to come back with all I asked for, hmmm?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: My, that was quick! Are you sure you have everything? Even the brass kettle?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Deary me, aren't these lovely! Thank you, young one. <sigh> I wish I could afford to buy such goods every day. But I have been tightening the purse strings of late.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: I should like to leave my son a tidy sum after I die. Not too much, of course, but enough that he can find a home for himself.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Would that my husband were alive to watch over Ealdwine after I'm gone... Yet it is better not to dwell on what could have been. I must set my son on his own two feet.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Mark my words, young one: treasure hunting will not end well for him, the same as─ Well, never mind who. The point is nothing I say can convince him to give it up.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Perhaps it would carry more weight coming from an adventurer. Well, then, I have another task for you: persuade my son to stop chasing treasure.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: He is somewhere in western La Noscea, I believe. If you can make him see the folly of his ways, then that crystal is yours.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Yes, these will do nicely. Thank you. ...I am sorry if I seem curt. It's just my Ealdwine went off on yet another treasure hunt just this morning.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Would you go and talk to him again? As best I could make out, he was bound for western La Noscea.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: It would lift the worry from my mind, and perhaps another lecture will be just the thing to make him stop treasure hunting.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Day in and day out, I huntsh and I huntsh, but I've nothing to show for me troublesh. It'll be yearsh 'fore I can bring Ma any bloody cheer...

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: 'Courshe, plummeting to me death won't make her lesh glum neither.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Aaah! When did ye─hic!─get here!? Byregot'sh gut, I need shomethin' to shoothe me nervesh after the shtart ye gave me!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Eh? Ye came on Ma'sh behalf? Hah! I'll wager─hic!─she wantsh ye to put paid to me treashure huntin' days.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Save yer shermon, friend─I'm not changin' me waysh. Ealdwine'sh a treashure hunter through an' through. Hellsh, I couldn't earn enough gil for watery grog if I tried me hand at shomethin' else.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: I know in me heart o' heartsh that me one, great treashure'sh still out there! An' I ain't quittin' till I've got it!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: 'Courshe, no one'sh shaid I've to go it on me own... How'd ye feel about huntin' me treashure for me?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: I jusht traded me lasht pair o' socksh for a tip or three, shee? Word ish, there'sh richesh losht shomewhere in Amdapor Keep, Pharos Siriush, an'─hic!─the Tam–Tara Deepcroft.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Now, they're a bit too periloush for ol' Ealdwine. But a 'venturer like ye will be jusht fine, won't ye?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: An' if any one o' thoshe treashuresh ish big enough for me and Ma to live like kingsh, then I sholemnly shwear to give up treashure huntin'─crossh me heart!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Yer not here on Ma'sh ordersh again, are ye? Hah, she'sh jusht as hardheaded as me.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Well, I'll tell ye same as lasht time─I'll only give up treashure huntin' when I find the richesh me pa died dreamin' of!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: But I got a lead. I were caroushin' lasht night, an' heard there'sh more treashure losht in Amdapor Keep, Pharos Siriush, an' the Tam–Tara Deepcroft!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: I know ye already looked, but ye musht've jusht─hic!─misshed it the lasht time. But if ye can turn up me one an' only, then I'll quit thish life!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Now leave me to me drink till ye've got coffersh full o' treashure with ye! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Me dreamsh will come true all for the losht richesh, me friend! Jusht think o' the grog the treashures will buy me!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: <sniff> That shmell─it ain't the sweet scent o'─hic!─treashure, ish it?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Three coffersh─that'sh a wondroush sight, friend! Let me pry theshe open and shee what'sh inshide! I tellsh ye, I haven't been sho exshited for...

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Nothin'... What!? Thish...thish ain't nothin' but a bunch o' queer knickknacksh! What wrinkly scrote thought thish shite was worthy o' keepin' in a treashure coffer!?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Ah well. Ol' Ealdwine don't get disheartened that eashily. Might be as I've got a trick up me shleeve. Shee, there'sh another losht treashure!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: An' you are goin' to find it for me in the Shtone Vigil! I'd do it meshelf, but I've tired meshelf out from all thish shoutin'!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: I've a good feelin' about thish time! Great richesh are callin' to me from─hic!─inshide theshe coffersh: open ush, open ush!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: ...Byregot'sh gut, theshe're filled with rubbish again. That bloke in the tavern'sh full o' shite. “Richesh so great I'd never have to work another day in me life”─hah!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: But I'm not─hic!─givin' up jusht like that. Ye've an idea o' why, don't ye?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: There'sh another treashure in the Shtone Vigil! Now if ye nab it for me, ol' Ealdwine will never ask nothin' o' ye again'! ...If the coffer ish full.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Me friend, why aren't ye in the Shtone Vigil? If ye bring me the richesh─hic!─what'sh losht there, I'll deal ye a cut an' spend me days happily soushed in grog!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Did ye find shomethin' in the Shtone Vigil, friend?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: 'Mazing bloody 'venturer, ye are! I can almosht tashte the treashure from here! Let'sh open her up, eh?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Knickknacksh...again!? <sniffle> And I was so shure that...I mean, the bloody losht treashure o' the Shtone Vigil!? Yearsh I've been at thish, an' for what?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: The Twelve're tellin' me shomethin', an' I'm bound to lishten. Their message ish loud an' clear: keep treashure huntin'!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: The more I─hic!─shtruggle now, the bigger me find will be. An' till I get me one an' only, there ain't no reashon to give up treashure huntin'! Shorry if ye were 'spectin' another anshwer, me friend.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Ah, don't shcrew up yer face like that. Ol' Ealdwine'll leave ye with a little shecret: tailor-made eel pie an' a piece o' perfect cloth. Give that pair to Ma, an' she'll give ye whatever ye wantsh!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Ma ain't so bad, even with the fusshin'. I know she'sh got me best intereshts at heart. She'sh jusht frettin' so I don't go the same way as Pa─may he resht in peace.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Died chasin' dreamsh o' wealth, Pa did. I only became a treashure hunter to walk in his footshteps. I meansh to find everythin' he sought, an' make Ma happy along the way.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Well, now ye know why I can't shtop! Ahahaha, anyroad, might be as ye can make Ma'sh treatsh from shomethin' old in the Silver Bazaar. Now I'm off to the tavern─hic!─in search o' new treashure!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Thish ish it! Thish ish the coffer what holdsh me untold richesh!

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: ...No, no, it don't. Byregot'sh buttock, why'sh it always junk an' refushe in theshe losht treashures?

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Well, ye 'member our deal─I ain't quittin' thish life till I've got me grand richesh.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: But ye worked hard, so I'll give ye the same advice as last time: a tailor-made eel pie an' a piece o' perfect cloth are the keysh to Ma'sh heart.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Well, I'm off to find new treashure. I'll keep an eye out for ye on the road─long as I ain't shleepin' one off in the ditch, ahaha!

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: You were gone for quite a while, adventurer. Does that mean my son has come to his sens─ Eh? You have something to give me?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Hehe, my favorite eel pie and some beautiful cloth for my needlework... And Ealdwine told you to get them, you say?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: That son of mine, remembering what is dear to my heart! Hehe, he might not have too much betwixt the ears, but he has a good heart.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: My late husband was just the same, always chasing his dreams. Now, my son is the very same. Little wonder he is off on yet another treasure hunt.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: And deary me, I had you running about after him! Thank you for trying. I should say you have more than earned this crystal.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Well, well, eel pie and some beautiful fabric. I suppose this means Ealdwine won't be giving up his treasure hunting?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: <sigh> He is truly his father's son, but I'll get him to stop chasing empty dreams someday.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: But that's my burden to bear. Here, have your alexandrite, and a mother's thanks.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have obtained all the necessary items to recreate a Zodiac Weapon. Report to Gerolt at Hyrstmill to proceed.
